title: Cashier / Reconciliation Officer Job at Guaranty Business Solutions
content:
Guaranty Business Solutions - Our client, a reputable Bar and Restaurant, is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier / Reconciliation Officer
Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Our client is seeking a diligent and trustworthy Cashier/Reconciliation Officer to manage daily cash handling, maintain accurate records of financial transactions, and reconcile inventory and sales reports for our bar and restaurant.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring transparency, accountability, and consistency across all cash and stock operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive and process all payments (cash, POS, transfers) from customers.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all transactions.
	Report any inconsistencies or discrepancies in inventory or cash records.
	Prepare daily and weekly reconciliation reports for management.
	Reconcile daily sales against inventory consumption for both the bar and restaurant.
	Work closely with kitchen and bar staff to verify stock usage and sales.
	Monitor stock movement and flag potential losses, breakages, or misuse.
	Ensure the cash register is balanced at the beginning and end of shifts.
	Assist in periodic stock counts and audits.
	Adhere strictly to internal controls and accounting standards.
	Ensure receipts and invoices are properly filed and organized.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE with strong numeracy and record-keeping skills.
	Proven experience in cash handling or bookkeeping in a bar/restaurant or similar environment.
	Proficient in basic Excel or accounting software is an added advantage.
	Must reside in or close to Surulere, Lagos.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.


Salary
N50,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: grpmesg@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Filmhouse Cinemas Limited
content:
Filmhouse Cinemas Limited is a dynamic film exhibition company. Our expertise are in the areas of: Cinema operations, management of sites, Ownership of sites, Consultancy for cinema development, Design Fit-out; Cinema project management, Film Distribution: Rights Acquisition, Booking into cinemas, and content development.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Site Auditor

Job Locations: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Essential Duties and Key Responsibilities include the following and other duties as may be assigned:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Detect signs of fraud, irregularities, or unauthorized activities within the site and escalate accordingly.
	Real time monitoring of sales and general operational activities.
	Drive revenue & cost efficiency; and ensure processes & procedures are followed in the day-to-day operations, escalating all exceptions to Internal Audit appropriately.
	Conduct independent verification, audit and reconciliation of Daily Sales with all relevant reports (Cash, POS, Bank transfers and other Online Payments), add notes on observed variances in the daily CASH & POS report to Finance.
	Reconciliation of all POS merchant copies by bank and report accordingly. Follow up with Support Office (SO) on resolution of charge back with the banks and report eventual settlement.
	Verification and sighting of all inventory items that are supplied to the site and signing appropriate document.
	Responsible for validating the cash evacuation process. This includes verification with the BM before the drop off and reconciling the accuracy of the figures. This also includes examining and verifying with the cash book and receipt book and reporting to Finance on banking days, and escalating exceptions to Internal Audit promptly.
	Verify, and document all cube bookings, all forms of rentals/hires and escalate all unethical and fraudulent practices suspected or observed at the Cinema to Internal Audit Department.
	Conduct daily stock counts and independent weekly stock counts and reconciliations.
	Conduct daily spontaneous cash drops for team members and complete cash till reconciliation.
	Complete cash count report/certificate to be sent monthly to Finance.
	Management and authorization of petty cash expenses, and preparation of Petty Cash Report to be sent to Internal Audit for approval.
	Daily count of all cash items in both safes with the BM/CM, vouching it against the Cash Count Certificate, Close Out Sheet and Daily Sales Report from Sales Ticketing System and signing off the Safe Reconciliation Sheet and Bank Logs, reporting all exceptions noted promptly to Internal Audit.
	Daily reconciliation of vouchers in safe, emergency tickets and all redemptions, confirming validity and accuracy of transaction.
	Responsible for site POS activity in conjunction with the Support Office Revenue Assurance Team, by ensuring they are in good working conditions, with the right POS bank mix. And ensuring availability of printing papers always.
	Ensure the financial information and assets of the company are well protected, preserved with confidentiality and available to the right people in the right format and time.


Other Duties:


	Support the finance department with monthly financial reconciliation process
	Support filling of statutory remittances and Internal Audit processes in conjunction with SO.
	Relate with Audit/Finance on Fixed Asset replacement/movement by reporting asset movements.
	Collaborating with security agencies to facilitate arrest of fraudsters, upon instruction from the support office.


Qualifications


	Minimum of HND / B.Sc Degree with at least 2 years of relevant experience.
	Knowledge of accounting theories, principles, methods, practices, and terminology in a multidisciplinary and multi-functional environment.
	Good Microsoft Office, excel and power point usage.


Additional Information
Key Skills & Competencies Requirements:


	Job knowledge – In-depth knowledge about financial accounting principles and processes.
	Planning and Organizational Skills - Ability to marshal resources (people, funding, material, support) to get things done; multi-task and use resources effectively and efficiently.
	Time management & organisation- Ability to meet deadlines and prioritise
	Communication Skills - Excellent written and oral communication skills. Will need to be able to communicate complex information in a clear and understandable way.
	Analytical skills - demonstrates the ability to picture, articulate, and solve multiple problems and concepts and make decisions that are reasonable and based on available information.
	Excellent report writing and presentation skills
	Daily count of all cash items in both safes with the BM/CM, vouching it against the Cash Count Certificate, Close Out Sheet and Daily Sales Report from Sales Ticketing System and signing off the Safe Reconciliation Sheet and Bank Logs, reporting all exceptions noted promptly to Internal Audit.
	Daily reconciliation of vouchers in safe, emergency tickets and all redemptions, confirming validity and accuracy of transaction.
	Responsible for site POS activity in conjunction with the Support Office Revenue Assurance Team, by ensuring they are in good working conditions, with the right POS bank mix. And ensuring availability of printing papers always.
	Ensure the financial information and assets of the company are well protected, preserved with confidentiality and available to the right people in the right format and time.

2.) HSE Officer

Job Locations: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Develop HSE Processes and Procedures and drives implementation and standards across the Filmhouse group operations.
	Review and maintain internal Documentation Process.
	Provide HSE Leadership and coordinate HSE related training programs and operational support to all levels where required.
	Responsible for all aspects of incident investigation including verifying root cause and recommendations for implementation and preventing a reoccurrence.
	Works closely with the Facility/development team on special projects involving construction, equipment design, hazardous assessments and maintenance. 6. Maintains current working knowledge of all applicable HSE regulations.
	Responsible for Audit and Inspection Process for all areas of operations to ensure compliance.
	Report writing for board quarterly risk review.
	Develops Monthly Mock drill scenarios and reviews feedbacks from drill report for all locations.
	Ensures emergency response systems, policies and procedures are in place to manage emergency situations and is maintained.


Qualifications


	Minimum of BSc Degree in any Science or Social Science related Course.
	Minimum experience (number of years) required to perform on the role
	Minimum of 5 years+ experience in health and safety (e.g in the hospitality and/or construction industry).
	Certifications in Health and Safety Courses (such as NEBOSH IGC 1 and 2, First Aid, etc.

3.) Driver

Job Location: Island, Lagos

Job Description


	Driving staff daily to their desired destinations
	Maintaining the vehicle safe and clean
	Using navigation apps to determine the best route.


Qualifications


	Proven experience as a Driver
	A valid driver’s license
	A clean driving record
	Familiarity with GPS devices
	Knowledge of area roads and neighborhoods
	Availability to occasionally take weekend and night shifts
	A polite and professional disposition
	Must reside in Lekki Phase 1.

title: Customer Service Representative (Ticketing) Job at GUO Transport Company Limited
content:
GUO Transport Company Limited - Founded in 1980, GUO Transport Company Limited is a division of G. U. Okeke & Sons Ltd. A household name in the transportation industry and one of the largest provider of intercity and interstate transportation, serving more than 200 destinations across Nigeria and West Africa with a modern, environmentally friendly fleet. The company has become an icon in the transportation industry, providing safe, enjoyable and affordable travel to millions of passengers annually. While GUO transport Co. is well known for its regularly scheduled passenger service, nationwide logistics solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative (Ticketing)
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Awka, Anambra
Employment Type: Contract

Key Responsibilties


	Greet and attend to walk-in customers in a courteous and professional manner.
	Sell travel tickets using the company’s booking system and issue receipts.
	Assist with rescheduling, cancellations, or ticket upgrades in line with company policy.
	Maintain updated knowledge of company policies, travel routes, peak periods, and promotional offers.
	Reconcile and account for daily ticket sales and submit sales reports to theAccounts Team
	Provide information on travel schedules, seat availability, destinations, and ticket fares.
	Respond to customer inquiries, complaints, or concerns at the terminal promptly and appropriately.
	Ensure proper documentation and accurate entry of customer and travel details in the system.
	Support boarding processes and guide passengers when necessary.
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area and ensure signage and information are up to date.


Requirements


	OND / HND / BSc Degree in any discipline (preferably in Business Administration, Social Sciences, or related fields.
	1 - 2 years of experience in customer service, preferably in a transport, hospitality, or retail environment.
	Good knowledge of Nigerian geography and intercity transport services is an advantage.
	Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in using basic computer applications and booking/ticketing software.
	Strong attention to detail and a customer-centric mindset.
	Ability to work under pressure and in a fast-paced terminal environment.
	Willingness to work weekends, holidays, and on shift rotations as required.


Preferred Qualities:


	Neat appearance and a friendly, helpful attitude.
	Dependable, honest, and punctual.
	Good problem-solving skills and ability to de-escalate tense situations.


Work schedule for this job role is as stated below:


	5:30am-1:30pm (morning shift)
	1:00pm-8:00pm (Afternoon shift)
	Mondays to Sundays with one day off every week.


Salary
N70,000 - N75,000 monthly.

title: Social Media and Content Creator Job at Home Bargains Nigeria Limited
content:
Home Bargains Nigeria Limited is a gift and decor store situated in Abuja, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media and Content Creator

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Schedule: Four times a week

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	In this role, you will create engaging content to showcase our unique gift products and enhance our brand presence.
	You'll be responsible for producing content for social media and promotional materials that connect with customers.
	If you’re passionate about gifts and content creation, we’d love to have you on board!


Responsibilities


	Create engaging video contentfor social media platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, etc.) that showcases products, store promotions, and seasonal offerings.
	Produce high-quality product videos, including unboxings, demonstrations, tutorials, and customer testimonials, to highlight the unique features of gift items.
	Design promotional videos and adsto support sales campaigns, new arrivals, and special events, ensuring videos are aligned with the brand’s aesthetic and goals.
	Collaborate with the marketing teamto develop content strategies that increase online visibility and drive traffic to the store.
	Edit and optimize videosfor each platform, ensuring content is tailored to platform-specific formats and engagement trends.
	Create attention-grabbing video contentthat showcases store events, product launches, or exclusive offers to entice customers.
	Design eye-catching promotional materials(such as banners, flyers, and social media posts) to support video content and store promotions.
	Monitor performance of video contentacross platforms, analyzing metrics to improve future content and drive higher sales conversions.
	Keep up with trendsin video marketing and social media to continuously evolve content and stay relevant to the target audience
	More tasks as may be required.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND qualification
	3 years of experience.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: ad.homebargains@gmail.com using the Job Positionas the subject of the mail.

title: Customer Service Representative Job at RevenStrat Consulting
content:
RevenStrat is a consultancy and advisory firm focused on helping both startups and established enterprises address their most challenging strategic issues. Our team is committed to guiding clients through disruptive market changes, helping them steer clear of pivotal business errors that could jeopardize their success.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative
Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Provide exceptional customer support and assistance to users of the company's e-commerce real estate platform.
	This role focuses on resolving customer inquiries, facilitating smooth user experiences, and ensuring customer satisfaction throughout their property journey.


Key Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries through multiple channels including phone, email, live chat, and social media
	Assist customers with platform navigation, property searches, and transaction-related questions
	Troubleshoot technical issues and coordinate with IT team for complex platform problems
	Process customer requests, account updates, and service modifications in a timely manner
	Collect and document customer feedback to inform product improvements and service enhancements
	Support customers through the property buying/selling process by coordinating with sales and operations teams
	Participate in customer service training and stay updated on product features and company policies
	Monitor customer satisfaction metrics and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives
	Maintain detailed records of customer interactions and follow up on outstanding issues
	Provide product information, pricing details, and guidance on platform features
	Escalate complex issues to appropriate departments and ensure timely resolution
	Assist with onboarding new customers and providing platform tutorials


Required Qualifications


	High school diploma or equivalent; Bachelor's degree preferred
	1-2 years of customer service experience, preferably in real estate, e-commerce, or technology sectors
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong problem-solving abilities and patience in handling customer concerns
	Proficiency in customer service software, CRM systems, and basic computer applications
	Ability to multitask and manage multiple customer interactions simultaneously
	Positive attitude and commitment to providing exceptional customer experiences
	Basic understanding of real estate terminology and processes preferred
	Flexibility to work various shifts including evenings and weekends as needed
	Bilingual capabilities (English and local language) preferred


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: humanresources@revenstrat.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We appreciate all applications; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
